intro: Physaria macrantha, commonly known as the broad-leaved bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has fleshy, lobed leaves and produces pods that contain seed-like structures called siliques. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, and is often found in disturbed areas. Physaria macrantha is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
